org.ensembl.registry
Class Registry

java.lang.Object
  org.ensembl.registry.Registry
public class Registry
extends java.lang.Object

A Registry provide convenient programatic access to multiple ensembl databases through DriverGroups.

Accessing ensembldb.ensembl.org.

A default registry providing access to the latest databases on ensembldb.ensembl.org can be created by Registry.createDefaultDriver(). This example shows how to access the latest human and compara databases on that database: 

 Registry r = Registry.createDefaultDriver();
 
 DriverGroup human = r.getGroupDriver("human");
       
   CoreDriver humanCore = human.getCoreDriver(); 
   Iterator genesIter = humanCore.getGeneAdaptor().fetchIterator(new Location("chromosome:10"));
       
       
   VariationDriver humanVar = human.getVariationDriver();
   Iterator vfIter = humanVar.getVariationFeatureAdaptor().fetchIterator(new Location("chromosome:10"));
        
   ComparaDriver compara = r.getDriverGroup("compara").getComparaDriver();
   List dnaDnaAlignFeatures = compara.getDnaDnaAlignFeatureAdaptor().fetch(
   "Homo sapiens", new Location("chromosome:1:1000000-1200000:0"),
   "Mus musculus", "BLASTZ_NET");

Default user registry

Databases added to the default user registry file are automatically available via the default user registry. For example Registry.createDefaultUserRegistry().getGroup("some_group") retrieves the "some_group" DriverGroup defined in the config file. See createDefaultUserRegistry(), getDefaultUserRegistryURL() and isDefaultUserRegistryAvailable() for more information.

Adding registries

Users can create additional Registry instances by using registry loaders. For example new Registry(new RegistryLoaderIni("my_config.ini")).

Author:
Craig Melsopp
See Also:
DriverGroup, RegistryLoaderIni

Method Detail

createDefaultRegistry

public static Registry createDefaultRegistry()
                                      throws AdaptorException
Create a registry pointing at the latest databases on ensembldb.ensembl.org. It is possible to disable/override the configuration. See getDefaultRegistry() for more information.

Returns:
registry pointing at the latest databases on ensembldb.ensembl.org.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
AdaptorException
See Also:
getDefaultRegistryURLs()

createDefaultUserRegistry

public static Registry createDefaultUserRegistry()
                                          throws AdaptorException
Create a registry from the default user registry file returned by getDefaultUserRegistryFile(). See RegistryLoaderIni for information on the file format.

Returns:
registry pointing at the latest databases on ensembldb.ensembl.org.
Throws:
AdaptorException
java.io.IOException
See Also:
RegistryLoaderIni, getDefaultUserRegistryURL()

getDefaultRegistryURLs

public static java.lang.String[] getDefaultRegistryURLs()
                                                 throws java.net.MalformedURLException
Returns the URLs of the configuration files used to initialise the default registry. The normal registry config files are "resources/data/default_registry_server.ini" and "resources/data/default_registry_groups.ini" which are found on the classpath (usually in ensj.jar). These can be overridden by a user created file USER_HOME_DIRECTORY/.ensembl/user_registry.ini. Although this is generally not necessary (you should use the default user registry to configure access to your own databases) one case where it is useful is if you have trouble connecting to ensembldb.ensembl.org (e.g.due to access/firewall restrictions) and your program does so automatically. In this case you can 'disable' access by creating an empty USER_HOME_DIRECTORY/.ensembl/user_registry.ini file or one that defines groups on another database server.

Returns:
urls of the configuration files that will be used initialise the default registry.
Throws:
java.net.MalformedURLException

getDefaultUserRegistryURL

public static java.lang.String getDefaultUserRegistryURL()
                                                  throws java.net.MalformedURLException
Returns the URL of the default user registry file. By default this is "file:USER_HOME_DIRECTORY_PATH/.ensembl/user_registry.ini" but this can be overridden by specifying an alternative URL via the JVM parameter USER_REGISTRY_URL. e.g. java -DUSER_REGISTRY_URL=file:/tmp/my_registry.ini MyProgram.

Returns:
URL of the default user registry file.
Throws:
java.net.MalformedURLException

isDefaultUserRegistryAvailable

public static boolean isDefaultUserRegistryAvailable()
Convenience method that checks whether the default user registry is available.

Returns:
true if the URL returned by getDefaultUserRegistryURL() can be opened, otherwise false.
See Also:
getDefaultUserRegistryURL()
